Deeply anguished to learn about the loss of lives due to tragic fire accident at the Srisailam hydroelectric plant in Telangana. My deepest condolences are with the bereaved families. May the injured recover at the earliest.
#NationalRecruitmentAgency is a unprecedented step taken by Modi govt as it would create an uniform transformative recruitment process. PM @NarendraModi ji has given the due right to the job seeking youth of the country by ensuring transparency & ease in the recruitment process.
NRA will provide equal opportunities to all sections of the society as each district will have an exam centre, test will be in multiple languages and CET score will be valid for 3 years. Single test will also reduce the financial burden, which will greatly benefit the candidates.
A landmark day for India's youth!

I thank PM @NarendraModi ji for approving the creation of #NationalRecruitmentAgency (NRA) in today's cabinet. This transformational reform will remove the hurdles of multiple exams for central govt jobs through Common Eligibility Test (CET).
Greetings to Finance Minister Smt @nsitharaman ji on her birthday. Under PM Modi's leadership, her zeal for bringing in transformative economic reforms across all sectors is truly commendable. Praying for her good health and long life.

Education is the foundation of any nation and for the last 34 years, India was in dire need of such a futuristic policy.

I express my gratitude to PM @NarendraModi & @DrRPNishank on this landmark policy decision which will play an unprecedented role in building of a #NewIndia.
Objective of National Education Policy 2020 is to bring in a huge transformational change in the Indian Education system through holistic and multidisciplinary approaches.
Focus on different aspects will lead to the overall development of the children across the country. #NEP2020
#NEP2020 will also have the provision of academic credit bank, increased investment in education system, internationalism of education, special education zone for disadvantaged regions, upgradation of KGBV‚Äôs to 12 grade and an increased focus on Lok Vidya & the use of technology.
#NEP2020 brings in various features like 5+3+3+4 system in school education, introduction of new 4-year courses, single point common regulatory system, fee fixation & common norms within board regulatory framework; along with multiple entry & exit points in higher education.
Modi govt‚Äôs #NEP2020 ensures that quality education will reach students of every section of the society, a special joint task force will be constituted to ensure the same. To increase the Gross Enrolment Ratio (GER) in higher education, continuous & strategic steps will be taken.
No nation in the world can excel by giving up its culture & values.

The aim of PM @NarendraModi‚Äôs #NEP2020 is to create an education system which is deeply rooted in Indian ethos and can rebuild India as a global knowledge superpower, by providing high-quality education to all.
A truly remarkable day in the history of Indian education system!

Under the visionary leadership of PM @narendramodi ji, Union Cabinet today approved 'New Education Policy 2020' for the 21st century. This brings in much needed historic reforms in both School & Higher Education.

tweet:
Supplication is one of the best cures for diseases of the heart. Communicate with your heart & soul. Get close to the Almighty. He will grant comfort. Don‚Äôt search for happiness in a place where you will not find it. Know that true happiness comes from Him and it lasts forever.
Sometimes the Almighty sends you blessings disguised in what you see as ugly packages. He wants to see your response. Will you give thanks & embrace the whole process or judge it at face value & react adversely to it? Don‚Äôt lose the plot. Don‚Äôt let Satan make you ungrateful!
The trials that come your way can make you better or bitter. They can make you grow up or give up. The Almighty‚Äôs watching your response. Have you got what it takes to go through tough trials? Will you bear good patience with a soft heart or will your heart harden in the process?
Do you keep going round in circles? Do you feel like you‚Äôre moving but not making any progress? Then you have to stop doing what you‚Äôre doing & take stock of your life. Reevaluate your priorities & shift your mindset. Get out of the rut. Seek your strength from the Almighty.
Don‚Äôt let your fears and worries crush you. Never feel alone in your internal panic. The Almighty knows every single thing about you. Keep asking Him. Keep confiding in Him. Let go of the worry that‚Äôs gripping you. Let Him take over and feel a sense of calm restored in you!
What is this life but a series of obstacles? The good news is nothing happens without the Almighty‚Äôs Will. If anything unpleasant comes into your life, it had to get approval from Him. He knows the kind of test you need. He‚Äôs placed a blessing inside of it. It‚Äôs for your good!
Life can be difficult if all you see is everything that‚Äôs wrong. Start focusing on what‚Äôs right, what‚Äôs good, what‚Äôs constructive. No matter what you‚Äôre facing, if you choose a positive mindset, you‚Äôll emerge the winner. So if you want to feel better, you‚Äôve got to think better!
Stop investing in your past. It‚Äôs over. Let it go. The Almighty has paved a way for you to move forward. Don‚Äôt be so engrossed with what was & what has been that you forget to acknowledge His Blessing for what is & what‚Äôs to come. Read the signs & make that change to your life!
Learn to be at peace with what the Almighty has chosen for you. If we allow that peace to reign in our hearts, our worldly stresses will dissipate & disappear. Don‚Äôt allow unanswered prayers for the moment to cause anger or bitterness. He has the best answer & solution always!
Are you always unhappy & discontented with life? If you are check yourself for these symptoms. Are you always criticising others; complaining that your life isn‚Äôt good enough; quick to condemn people or comparing yourself with your neighbours? Stop all that & feel the difference!
Almighty. Grant us tranquility & hope in this pandemic that seems far from over. Many are confused & helpless as nations go back into lockdown. Keep us thankful always as many are suffering a lot more than us. We ask You for beautiful patience to endure what lies ahead. Aameen!
Alimighty. Help us get rid of jealousy & envy from our hearts. They‚Äôre the cause of many of today‚Äôs woes. Help us understand that envy eats & rots the heart. Forgive us when we grumble how You bless others. Help us avoid comparison & learn to be at peace with Your Blessings.
Anger is a choice. We can choose to retreat into our own minds and calm down or we can explode. Anger takes a lot of energy. Fighting, using derogatory words and showing acts of violence don‚Äôt solve any problem. Instead, take a step back, rationalise and seek the Almighty‚Äôs help!
When you have a grateful heart, you have everything. You acknowledge the goodness in your life. The Almighty will grant you more. He will increase your sustenance; ease your affairs; open doors you never thought possible. He will make you feel abundant rather than deprived!
Don‚Äôt expect everyone to react the way you do when confronted with a difficult situation. Remember, we have all been brought up differently and have different life experiences. This will determine our reaction to various situations. So be kind always and remember we all struggle!
We are humans and we are prone to mistakes and sins. Never mind how many times you‚Äôve sinned but the biggest mistake is to lose hope in the Almighty‚Äôs Mercy. Keep repenting. Keep turning back to Him. Always believe that He will forgive you. This is what sets us apart from Satan!
People expect instant miracles everyday. Not everything in life is like that. You have to go through a process. We have become impatient when supplicating, expecting instant response. The Almighty doesn‚Äôt work like that. We need to learn patience, live a life of gratitude.
Avoid suspicion. It‚Äôs a trait of Satan and detested by the Almighty. It stems from a heart that is insecure and always full of doubt. At its worst, it can turn into hate; harming people and destroying relationships. Counter it with optimism, positive thoughts and firm faith!
Life is indeed a journey. Successful is he who can navigate the ups and downs without losing his balance. Don‚Äôt dwell on your past, don‚Äôt wallow in self-pity, don‚Äôt repeat your mistakes, don‚Äôt focus on negativity, help others along the way, spread kindness wherever you go!
Do good, even what you consider to be insignificant acts. The Almighty sees, hears & knows everything. He will reward you for it. Remember unlike humans, He‚Äôs above glitches, errors & system failures. He is perfect but He doesn‚Äôt expect perfection from us. Only sincere effort!
Do you have scars to show? They are proof of inner strength. They show us that we‚Äôre all warriors really; even if we were gasping for air for a while. Scars show what we‚Äôve been through & how strong we are for coming out of it because the Almighty chose to restore us! Thank Him!
Quit procrastinating. Stop putting things off. So often in life, we feel like we can delay things & do them much later. But we may never have the same opportunities again. This life is so transient. Here today, gone tomorrow. You‚Äôve seen that happen. So best to do it now!
When someone wrongs you, instead of retaliating, learn to respond with kindness & patience. It‚Äôs possible if you set your heart & mind to it. If the Almighty is gracious to you why can‚Äôt you do the same to others? Be compassionate. No one knows what others are going through.
Every now and then, life will throw you a curveball when you least expect it. The Almighty sends them to disrupt your daily, comfortable routine. They‚Äôre a blessing in disguise. You‚Äôll eventually realize. He‚Äôs watching to see if you‚Äôve got what it takes to pull through!
We don‚Äôt deny that money is important. But you don‚Äôt have to go crazy over it. The Almighty has written it down for you, there‚Äôs no need for you to lie, cheat, deceive, resort to fraudulent practices, abuse the rights of others just to make some extra bucks. Greed doesn‚Äôt pay!
Stop complaining & start living. It has been a disruptive year with most of our plans put on the back burner but understand that our lives have changed & we won‚Äôt be going back to what it was before the pandemic. Be thankful for what you have & keep moving forward. #newnormal
Lower your¬†expectations of others or better still, have zero expectations. That way you‚Äôre less likely to get hurt or disappointed. Rely on none other than the One who made you. Ask from none other than Him. Keep asking. Pray. Your prayers can‚Äôt be answered if you don‚Äôt pray!
Almighty. Amid these uncertain times, we thank You for the challenges & struggles; they‚Äôve  brought us closer to You. Amid the darkness, we see Your light; in our fear, we feel Your strength. We pray for compassion & love for others. Keep our hearts attached to You. Aameen!
Don‚Äôt rush things in life. The Almighty loves  patience. He makes everything beautiful in His timing, which is always the best. If He‚Äôs making you wait, there‚Äôs a reason. Don‚Äôt let Satan tempt you into believing that the Almighty‚Äôs not listening to your calls. He always listens!
If the Almighty wants you to do something, He will give you the ability to carry it out to the best of your ability. Keep believing in yourself and keep Him in focus. Keep your head down and cut out distractions from your life. He will guide you. That‚Äôs how you will succeed!
You can choose to either let fear paralyze you or allow your faith to take over & let the Almighty guide you. It can be a daunting task when you don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on but if you trust Him, He can make the impossible a reality. That‚Äôs His job. Learn to move forward by faith!
Have you sincerely repented? When you regret the sins you‚Äôve committed, feel sad for having committed them & feel pain when you remember them, these are signs of sincere repentance. But after this, Satan will cause you to doubt the Almighty‚Äôs Mercy. Don‚Äôt fall for it!
Almighty. No matter how many trials You send our way, let us not feel helpless or give up hope because we know You have our backs always. Help us to realise that You‚Äôre our source of peace and we will never be able to attain true peace of mind without You in our lives!
If you get back to basics, life is really not that complicated. Try to keep it simple. Stay true to who you are. Don't worry about what other people think of you. They will always have an opinion. Just do your best. Surround yourself with good people. Settle for nothing less!
People will usually show their true colours when you‚Äôre in need of help or facing some crisis. Remember, fair-weather friends are aplenty. They hang around you in good times. Their true nature is never shown or disclosed until times of trouble. You‚Äôll know your true friends then!
You may be penniless, homeless, unemployed, sick and feel like you have nothing. But you have the one thing that money can't buy: the Almighty. He knows what you want, what you need, what you deserve, at what time & place, trust Him & His decisions. He knows while you don't.
Updated pic of 2020 #muftimenk #Kazunga #Zimbabwe https://t.co/i0VdJ1es2r
Are you guilty of this? Always criticizing others because you‚Äôre impatient? You don‚Äôt tolerate those who behave differently. You expect people to behave like you. When we focus on someone else‚Äôs flaw, we stop seeing the person. We just see their mistakes. Stop this bad habit!
Disengage yourself when you find that you‚Äôre in the company of those who love to gossip. It may be hard to get out of it but you must. You don‚Äôt want to be a bad listener, but always remember, you‚Äôre not accountable for their words. Instead, you‚Äôll be taken to task for yours!
Breathe a huge sigh of relief &  smile at what the Almighty has blessed you with. Remember, it could always be worse. Learn to look at those who have less than you. That way you will never undervalue His blessings. And when you appreciate what you have, He gives you more!
Letting go is incredibly difficult. Some find it hard to move on, clinging on to their past. Seek your strength from the Almighty. Life is all about change. No matter how hard we try to keep things as they are, change will come eventually. So let go when you know you have to!
We take tomorrow for granted because we believe tomorrow will always be there. Yes, tomorrow may be there, but remember, we may not! Who said "tomorrow" is guaranteed? Make the most of "today" that you are blessed with! Yesterday, many thought that they would see today!
Maybe the Almighty‚Äôs teaching you how to wait because He wants you to know that you can‚Äôt actually control your life no matter how hard you try. You may think you‚Äôre holding the reins but the truth is you‚Äôre not because that‚Äôs His job, not yours. Lest you forget!
Almighty. We pray for healing. The world seems to be spiraling out of control. There‚Äôs widespread mayhem. We even see chaos in our own lives.There are days where we feel demoralized. You're the only One who can lift our spirits & will truly listen. You have all the answers!
Almighty. We pray for ease amidst all the suffering going on in the world today. May You comfort every heart that‚Äôs experiencing the heaviness of loss. Only You can heal the brokenness and void left by loved ones gone. It‚Äôs a very trying period for many. Grant us utmost patience!
Never doubt that whatever trial  the Almighty sends your way, you‚Äôll be able to handle it. He will never ask you to do something that you can‚Äôt do. He will never test you beyond your capabilities. You are fully equipped, qualified, and capable to face the trials. Trust Him!
Why do you resent other people‚Äôs success? The trouble is social media makes it worse. You believe that everyone else is happier & wealthier as you view their posts. Stop comparing yourself to others. Reframe your mindest. your job is to do your best with what you‚Äôve been given!
Sometimes the hardest person to correct is yourself. There is no shame in being wrong. We are human and we make mistakes. The shame is in choosing to stay on the wrong path. Make that change, as difficult as you think it is. Take that first step; get back on track!
Listen to your instincts. Depending on the state of your piety & heart, they can be your moral compass. If you keep purifying your heart, the Almighty will send you a light to distinguish between truth & falsehood, right & wrong. So pay attention to your gut feel & sixth sense!
Good and bad days exist in this journey called life. One day you feel broken, the next day you feel whole. It‚Äôs all part of the Almighty‚Äôs Plan. It‚Äôs teaching us to lay complete trust in Him. Remember, we walk by faith. He will not allow us to break, He will carry us through!
Heartbreaking, devastating, tragic, horrific scenes from #Beirut. My thoughts & prayers are with #Lebanon today. The sheer magnitude of the #BeirutExplosions! Almighty, help them overcome such a difficult time. We seek Your Mercy and strength!  #BeirutBlasts
We sin & make mistakes daily. Everyone who makes a mistake deserves another chance; we‚Äôre human enough to make a mistake. Therefore, everyone deserves another chance. Imagine, if the Almighty accepts our repentance & is willing to forgive, shouldn‚Äôt we do the same for others?
When making tough decisions in life, always be sure you‚Äôll be pleasing the Almighty and not incurring His wrath. That way, you‚Äôll always find yourself guided because at the end of the day, the final judgement is up to Him alone. Don‚Äôt worry what people will think or say!
No matter how much you regret it or worry about what happened, the past is over. You can‚Äôt change a thing. But you can come to terms with the fact that everything happens for a reason. Live in the present where the Almighty has given you the options to restore calm to your heart!

Are you among those who‚Äôll spend most of your time fixing other people‚Äôs problems but your life‚Äôs a mess? Remember, charity begins at home. The best way to help others is to help yourself first. Invest your time in being a better version of yourself; everything else will follow.
Stop sweating the small stuff. Always remember how short this life is. All it takes is a split second for things to change. Learn to be grateful. Focus on His blessings no matter how small it is. The happiest people don‚Äôt have everything but they make the most of what they have.
Don‚Äôt be surprised if people try to detour you from your path when you‚Äôre doing well and headed in the right direction. It‚Äôs a normal human trait. Recognize it. Know their game and be on full alert. Stand your ground politely but firmly. Do what you must and don‚Äôt be distracted.
Almighty. Grant us the strength & the courage to carry on. A lot‚Äôs going on around us & it‚Äôs easy to become despondent. Our energy & motivation are constantly being tested. Don‚Äôt let the pressures of life push us down. Help us not to quit but to keep going at a steady pace!
@Cornerstore26 Much love habeebee. You just gave me an opportunity to add value to the discussion. You said nothing wrong. Have a lovely evening!
@Cornerstore26 üòÇRelax! When prayers are answered 30 years later & the excitement is so much that the pain of previous losses is forgotten, surely the lesson learnt glares us in the face! Never give up! Never! I didn't even take sides. Beautiful religious tweet. Your turn to pray if I may add!
Never give up! Never! #30YearsLater #Liverpool #PremierLeague
If your heart is not in the right place, you‚Äôll never feel at ease. Purify your intenion in everything that you do. In this age of social media it‚Äôs easy to show off, get carried away & thrive on exaggerated needs for acceptance & validation. Protect your heart at all times.
The Almighty is the Controller of Hearts. He can change things in the blink of an eye. Don‚Äôt forget! He can heal what has been hurting for years in a flash. He can forgive as He wills. Nothing is beyond the Lord of the Worlds. Have faith that things will work out in the end.
Pay heed to whatever comes out of your mouth. Every word you utter matters. It really does. You may not think so but trust me when I say that the power of words is immense. It can make you or break you. It has the ability to change someone‚Äôs life! Choose your words carefully!
Man is always comparing. We often feel the other person is in a much better state than we are. Instead of accepting & appreciating what we have, we always find a way to look at what others have. Be wary. In trying to achieve something better, one may end up losing what one has!
Don‚Äôt worry about how people act. That‚Äôs on them not you. Always choose kindness, that‚Äôs under your control. Spread it far and wide, whichever way you can, even if it means giving a smile or a word of encouragement. Never underestimate how contagious being kind can be!
Learn to see the best in people. Believe the best about them too. No matter how much you disagree, try to find common ground. Spread peace. Quit fighting and bickering. Build bridges. Don‚Äôt hate. Don‚Äôt look down on anyone. Life‚Äôs too short to be doing otherwise.
Quit stressing yourself unnecessarily. If you‚Äôve done your best, then leave it to the Almighty. If something‚Äôs out of your hands, it deserves freedom from your mind too!  Overthinking is not going to change it. Let Him work it out for you. Be prepared for the best outcome!
Big changes can be made in small steps. If you want the change to last, then you need more than a "just do it" mentality. It needs to be slowly cultivated till it becomes part of you. Then pray hard & ask the Almighty to guide you. If anyone can help, it's the One who made you!
Be wary of greed. And it‚Äôs not just about money. You can be greedy for material possessions, fame, compliments etc. Whatever it is, greed is a spiritual disease of the heart and is always destructive. So work on your heart to drive greed out. Learn to share, give generously!
The Almighty‚Äôs not only the source of love but the only One truly worthy of love! People will always let us down. Impermissible relationships will end in heartbreak. That‚Äôs why when we give them our hearts completely, we end up suffering heartbreak after heartbreak! Take heed!
Do you live your life to please others? If so, you‚Äôll never know peace because nothing you do will be good enough. If you make decisions based on what others will think of you, it‚Äôs time for a rethink! Where does the Almighty figure in your life? Reflect! Live your life for Him
Life is really not that complicated. You reap what you sow. You get what you give. Whatever you‚Äôre criticising in others, exists in you. If you‚Äôll only recognise it. So treat life well. What goes around comes around. Make sure you give goodness, kindness & all things positive!
Remember, Satan works the hardest when you‚Äôre about to make a breakthrough. You need to hold on to your faith, stay the course & draw yourself even closer to the Almighty. Resist the temptation, ignore the whispers; keep fighting. Build a barrier by seeking refuge in your Maker!
Go out of your way to become a humble person. Yes! Cultivate humility. Do it with a passion. Life will test you with anything & everything. It‚Äôs easy to be humble when being tested & trying to cope. But staying humble when the Almighty‚Äôs blessed you reveals your true self!
Almighty. We pray for those suffering in the world today. May the poor & vulnerable have sufficient access to their basic needs. May those who have lost homes & loved ones be treated with mercy & compassion. Replace their panic with peace & despair with hope! Aameen.
Whenever we find something that irritates us about others, it‚Äôs time to look inward, scrutinise ourselves. The tendency is to look outward. Resist the temptation. Remember, your reaction is about you. Your bias, your judgement, your prejudice. You‚Äôll end up hurting yourself.
Nothing lasts. The same goes for people who come into your life to show you a thing or two. Remember, no one crosses your path unless it‚Äôs planned by the Almighty. It doesn‚Äôt happen by accident. So cherish the moments you have with them because not everyone will stay forever.
Learn to listen to your own voice; your own heart; your own soul. Focus on that regardless of what others might tell you. Why? Because there‚Äôs too much noise around us, loud decibels accosting us daily. Sadly, people tend to listen to all that noise instead of themselves!
Don‚Äôt be jealous when you see someone having more than you. Remember, the Almighty blesses us differently. Don‚Äôt compare. Instead show gratitude so He can bless you with even more. Never forget that He has given you so much already; honestly, you‚Äôll never be able to count them!
Do you feel angry or resentful when being corrected or shown the truth? If you do, then you have a problem with pride! Be wary because even a atom‚Äôs weight of it can bar you from Paradise! So work on your heart. Purify it. Humble yourself to people. Get rid of self-importance!
Some people feel a little lost when they don‚Äôt get enough attention from others. So they make fun of people, belittle them and say nasty things about them in order to get the attention they so badly desire. Try to counsel them if you can. Say a prayer for them. They need it!
Remember, the Almighty does not expect us to have all the answers. He knows, as humans, our knowledge is limited. But that‚Äôs no excuse for not seeking knowledge. He expects us to learn; have unwavering faith in Him; knowing that He‚Äôs always there & that He rewards those who try!
Do you often feel confused & unsettled? Perhaps your heart feels like something‚Äôs amiss? Learn to cultivate inner peace by drawing yourself closer to the Almighty. Trust Him completely. He will guide you through it all. He will show you where you need to go to feel whole again!
Don‚Äôt be foolish and expose every blessing the Almighty has given you to everyone and think that they‚Äôll be happy for you. The truth is some will but many won‚Äôt. The evil eye is real. Learn to keep things private and not to share too much with those who could possibly harm you.
If you‚Äôre always looking for ways to expose others, you have a problem that needs fixing. Remember, the Almighty said if you expose others, He‚Äôll surely expose you, even if you‚Äôre hiding in the tiniest corner of the room. If you have good intentions, do it privately not publicly!
Whatever you‚Äôre facing right now, whatever you‚Äôre dealing with won‚Äôt last. Nothing does. So get a perspective on life. Things will get better. That‚Äôs the Almighty‚Äôs promise. Tomorrow brings new hope. Daybreak will happen. Get hold of yourself and keep moving. You‚Äôll get there!
You‚Äôre allowed to disagree with others, state your opinion respectfully but NEVER get physical or violent. This quality makes us distinct from animals! Be civilised, listen to what others are saying but avoid knee-jerk reactions. It would save you from a whole lot of regret!

One quizzical element is the S-shaped line poking out from the building‚Äôs roof. Art historian William Kloss speculates that this is part of a lightning protection system that once encircled the White House roof. (4/5)
Entitled "The President‚Äôs House," it shows the soot-stained windows, deteriorating stone, and the Executive Mansion as a hollowed shell. The Ailanthus trees in the foreground sprouting on the untended grounds heighten this mood. (3/5)
Painter George Munger captured the destruction in this watercolor sometime before repairs began the next March. (2/5)

Image Credit: White House Collection / White House Historical Association https://t.co/Hlh82Njoca
On the night of August 24, 1814, the fires that were set by British forces in Washington could be seen as far away as Baltimore. A historic storm compounded the destruction. Washington, D.C., lay in ruin. (1/5)

RT @WHhistoryPres: Yesterday marked 206 years since the burning of the White House by British forces during the War of 1812. In this week‚Äôs‚Ä¶
‚ÄúYou had better remove the records‚Äù --James Monroe to James Madison as the British approached in August 1814.

(9/9)
Rebuilding the Executive Mansion in the same location and design became a point of pride, and original architect James Hoban did just that. In October 1817, President James Monroe moved into the White House, where every American president and his family has lived since. (8/9)
Less than a month later, Americans claimed a key victory when Fort McHenry repulsed British forces in Baltimore. The Treaty of Ghent and the American victory at the Battle of New Orleans helped frame the war as a national victory. (7/9)
President James Madison stayed in the countryside for more than a day while the British occupied the capital. The episode marked the lowest point of the War of 1812 for American morale. (6/9)

Image: White House Historical Association https://t.co/JL0u877u9E
When the British arrived at the empty President‚Äôs House, they enjoyed the evening meal that had been prepared for guests of the first family before setting the building afire. (5/9)
The Declaration of Independence, the Articles of Confederation, the Constitution, the Bill of Rights, the papers of George Washington, the State Department, and of Congress, along with treaties, laws, and correspondence dating back to 1789 were kept safe. (4/9)
Throughout the District of Columbia, other heroes preserved what they could. Clerks John Graham, Stephen Pleasanton, and Josias King packed up vitally important documents. (3/9)
Learning of the British advance, First Lady Dolley Madison directed staff, including the French steward, Jean-Pierre Sioussat, and her enslaved servant, Paul Jennings, to save the Gilbert Stuart portrait of George Washington. (2/9)

Later, the USS Mayflower was converted into a cargo ship and used during World War II; it also transported Jewish refugees and Holocaust survivors to Israel after the war. 7/7
The opulent USS Mayflower came with a substantial price: $300,000 per year. This exorbitant cost led President Herbert Hoover to decommission the yacht in 1929. 6/7

In preparation for battle, the ship boasted torpedoes and sixteen rapid-fire guns, while the interior included marble bathtubs and sinks, brocaded interior staterooms, a mahogany and leather-furnished library, spacious saloons and reception rooms, and a mahogany piano. 5/7
The 273-foot yacht was fit for both conflict and luxury, and newspapers called it a ‚Äúmarvel of speed and elegance.‚Äù 4/7

It also functioned in a recreational capacity, and Woodrow Wilson even wooed his future bride, First Lady Edith Bolling Galt, aboard the USS Mayflower. 3/7
The ‚Äúfloating White House‚Äù housed diplomatic negotiations in the Russo-Japanese War in 1905, spearheaded by President Theodore Roosevelt. 2/7
The USS Mayflower participated in the blockade of Havana, Cuba, during the Spanish-American War‚Äô however, in 1905, it was commissioned to serve as the presidential yacht. It quickly became a favorite White House getaway for presidents. 1/7

They circulated among citizens like modern-day trading cards. ‚ÄúCartomania‚Äù was at the height of its popularity during the American Civil War, and the small photographs made perfect mementos for soldiers and families missing their loved ones while separated by battle. 4/6
These collectibles epitomized popular culture in the nineteenth century, as fans amassed images of their favorite celebrities including actors, authors, and politicians. 3/6

Cartes de visite, or ‚ÄúCDVs‚Äù were easy to print and affordable for everyday buyers, the small images became popular collectibles, traded between friends and lovers, and displayed in family albums. 2/6
